text: 55-year-old female diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma of the left breast.
Patient presents with T2N1M0 Stage IIB breast cancer.
Treatment plan involves AC-T chemotherapy followed by surgery.
Prescribed Anastrozole 1mg daily for 5 years.
History of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus.
Sentinel lymph node biopsy was positive for metastasis.
Started on Tamoxifen for hormonal therapy.
Patient reports fatigue and nausea post-chemotherapy.
Follow-up mammogram showed no evidence of recurrence.
Recommended genetic testing for BRCA1/2 mutations.
Diagnosis: Triple-negative breast cancer.
Patient is allergic to Penicillin.
Completed 6 cycles of Docetaxel and Carboplatin.
Physical exam reveals a palpable lump in the right breast.
Referral to radiation oncology for adjuvant therapy.
Bone scan negative for distant metastasis.
Patient is post-menopausal.
Tumor markers CEA and CA 15-3 are within normal limits.
Admitted for mastectomy and reconstruction.
Family history significant for breast cancer in mother.
